(hereinafter referred to as the “Consultant” which expression shall, wherever the context permits, be deemed to include its successors-in-interest and permitted assigns);
(The Consultant and the Client shall hereinafter be collectively referred to as the “Parties” and individually as the “Party” )

A)   The Client has invested in  
.
B)   The Consultant has represented to the Client that its experts possess the expertise and experience to provide the Services (as defined below) to the Client in accordance with the terms and conditions of this Agreement.
C)   The Client has agreed to engage the Consultant for the provision of the Services (as defined below) and the Consultant has agreed to accept the said engagement in accordance with the terms and conditions set forth herein.
NOW THEREFORE , in consideration of the mutual covenants and understandings contained herein, the Parties agree as follows:

(e)   recitals and Annexures to this Agreement shall be an integral and operative part of the Agreement and any breach thereof or misrepresentation contained therein in a material respect at the time of execution of the Agreement shall entitle the Parties to the same remedies as are available in respect of other terms of this Agreement;
(f)   in case of any conflict or inconsistency between any term of an Annexure and this Agreement, the terms of this Agreement shall prevail over the terms contained in the Annexure to the extent of the conflict and/or inconsistency.

(2.1)   The Client hereby appoints the Consultant to provide the Services and the Consultant hereby accepts such appointment and agrees to complete the Services for the Fee stipulated in Clause 3 below within the Agreed Dates and in accordance with the terms and conditions of this Agreement.
(2.2)   The Consultant shall provide the Services during the term of this agreement.
(2.3)   The Parties shall meet at mutually agreed times to discuss progress of the Services and to exchange feedback.
(2.4)   The Consultant shall provide the Services at such locations as notified by the Client in writing.
(2.5)   In provisions of the Services, the Consultant shall comply with all reasonable instructions of the Client.
(2.6)       The Client shall provide to the Consultant copies of any rules, regulations or policies of the Client that must be followed by the Consultant and its personnel during the provision of the Services including, without limitation, the Client’s code of conduct and security procedures.

Not withstanding the above, the Consultant may issue an invoice for payment under (b) to include any out of pocket expenses incurred, as detailed in 3.3, via an email notice. All invoices, unless disputed, shall in any case be deemed accepted and come payable within 15 (fifteen) business days from the date of receipt of the invoice by the Client.
(3.3)       The Client hereby agrees that other than the Fee, the Consultant shall be entitled to the reimbursement of incidental costs including but not limited, lodging (including meals) and transportation (excluding air travel) of the Consultant’s Team, subject to an aggregate limit of the PKR equivalent of
 
, which shall be billed at actual on a monthly basis and shall be supported with all relevant invoices, receipts and bills. For any costs exceeding the above aggregate limit, the Consultant shall obtain the Client’s prior written approval before incurring the same which shall not be unreasonably withheld. PKR equivalency will be calculated per Clause 3.4.

(3.4)       The Client shall make payment of the Fee and any other amounts under this Clause 3 in the Consultant’s bank account having the following details, in PKR equivalent of USD, to be calculated using State Bank of Pakistan’s daily quoted foreign exchange rate (https://www.sbp.org.pk/ecodata/CRates/Current.asp), prevailing on the date of invoice submission (i.e., customer transaction date is date of invoice submission):

Each Party agrees to keep all Confidential Information confidential and not to disclose it to anyone, save to the extent permitted by the disclosing Party in writing or as required by law (and to the extent permitted), and to ensure that all Confidential Information is protected with security measures and a degree of care that would apply to its own confidential information. Notwithstanding termination/expiry of this Agreement, the confidentiality obligations shall survive till such time until Confidential Information has been either returned by the receiving Party to the disclosing Party or destroyed by the receiving Party (at the instructions of the disclosing Party).
Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in this Agreement, each Party and its representatives may disclose, without liability under this Agreement, any Confidential Information if such disclosure is (a) reasonably believed by it to be compelled or required by, or advisable to be disclosed under, any law, rule, regulation or governmental request, court decree or other legal, administrative, governmental or regulatory request, order or proceeding, (b) necessary or appropriate in connection with any litigation or other proceeding to which it or any of its affiliates is a party, or (c) otherwise in connection with the protection or enforcement of rights relating to the Agreement provided that if the Consultant becomes so obliged or is requested to disclose the same, the Consultant shall (save as prohibited by law or regulation) give the Client prompt notice of such obligation, so that the Client may seek an appropriate protective/restraining order or other appropriate remedy. Notwithstanding the above, in the event that the Consultant is nevertheless required to disclose the Confidential Information under compulsion of law, the Consultant shall disclose only such part of the Confidential Information as they are so required to disclose.

(6.1)       The Parties acknowledge and agree that the Client is and shall be the sole and exclusive owner of all Intellectual Property Rights in all work produced by the Consultant under this Agreement, including, but not limited to data, materials, writings, reports, outlines, drafts, any other materials, in any medium (the “Work Product” ). The Parties further agree that the Consultant shall continue to own all Intellectual Property Rights in any proprietary information, data or materials prepared by the Consultant before being appointed by the Client which are either shared with the Client or which are used by the Consultant in the provision of the Services under this Agreement.
(6.2)       The Consultant shall, and shall cause all its personnel and permitted subcontractors to, take all appropriate actions and execute and deliver all documents necessary or reasonably requested by the Client to effectuate any of the provisions of this Clause 6, or otherwise as may be necessary for the Client to register, perfect or record its rights in any Work Product or any Intellectual Property Rights therein.

(7.1)       The Consultant hereby agrees to protect, indemnify and hold the Client its affiliates, officers, directors, president, agents, representatives and employees ( “Indemnified Persons” ) harmless from any and all damages, losses, liabilities, claims, suits, proceedings, demands, costs and/or expenses incurred by and/or made against any of the Indemnified Persons arising directly from the performance of the Services by the Consultant under this Agreement and/or breach of this Agreement by the Consultant or incurred by any Indemnified Persons as a result of the Consultant’s negligence and/or the negligence of its personnel provided that the Consultant shall not be liable under this Section 7.1 to the extent that any such damage, loss, claim, cost, expense or liability is caused or contributed by the Client or any of its affiliates, officers, directors, president, agents, representatives and employees or results from the breach by the Client of this Agreement or is a result of the Client’s negligence and/or the negligence of its personnel(s).
(7.2)       The Consultant hereby agrees to protect, indemnify and hold the Indemnified Persons harmless from and against any and all claims, suits, proceedings, and/or demands made by any third party for infringement or alleged infringement of any patent or other Intellectual Property Rights covering any Work Product and/or any property, equipment, design, drawing or other item used by the Consultant in the performance of the Services.
(7.3)       The Client agrees to protect, indemnify and hold the Consultant, its affiliates, officers, directors, president, agents, representatives and employees ( “Consultant Indemnified Persons” ) harmless from any and all damages, losses, liabilities, claims, suits, proceedings, demands, costs and/or expenses incurred by and/or made against any of the Consultant Indemnified Persons arising out of or in connection with the breach of this Agreement by the Client or incurred by any Consultant Indemnified Persons as a result of the Client’s negligence and/or the negligence of its personnel.
Any such notice, demand or communication shall be deemed to have been duly served on and received by the addressee at the time of successful transmission, if delivered by electronic mail.

(11.1)       If a Party hereto is affected by “force majeure” (which means any circumstances beyond the reasonable control of that Party, including, without limitation, any act of God, riot, strike, mob violence, natural disaster, pandemic, lock-out or other industrial action) it shall promptly notify the other Party of the nature and extent of the circumstance leading to such force majeure. Notwithstanding any other provision of this Agreement, a Party hereto shall not be deemed to be in breach of this Agreement, or otherwise be liable to the other Party for any delay in performance or non-performance of any obligations under this Agreement, to the extent that the delay or non-performance is due to force majeure of which it has notified the other Party, and the time for performance of that obligation shall be extended accordingly. Where the delay in performance due to the force majeure continues for a period of 15 (fifteen) continuous days, a Party may forthwith terminate this Agreement by written notice.

(14.1)       This agreement constitutes the entire agreement and supersedes any prior oral or written agreements or communication between the two parties regarding its subject. The provisions of this agreement are severable so that if any terms or provision is found for any reason to be invalid, illegal, or unenforceable, such finding shall not affect the validity, construction, or enforceability of any remaining terms or provision. This Sub-agreement may be amended or modified only by a mutual written agreement (modification) of the parties.
IN WITNESS WHEREOF the parties hereto have made and executed this Agreement on the day, month and year written herein above.

p.b: For and on behalf of Vital Pakistan Trust
For and on behalf of RAYN (PVT) LTD
